questions.title: JavaScript Variable Declaration
questions.questionText: The 'let' keyword in JavaScript allows you to declare block-scoped variables.

questions.title: JavaScript Basics
questions.questionText: Which keyword is used to declare a block-scoped variable in JavaScript?

options.text: var – declares function-scoped variables, which can cause issues in block scoping.
let – declares block-scoped variables, reducing scoping problems.
const – declares block-scoped variables whose values cannot be reassigned.
int – a keyword from other languages, but not valid in JavaScript.

questions.title: Programming Languages
questions.questionText: In a few words, explain why JavaScript is considered a versatile language.

questions.title: Order of Planets
questions.questionText: Arrange the planets in order from closest to farthest from the Sun:

entry.title: World War II Allies
entry.item_body: Which of the following countries were part of the Allied Powers during World War II?

feedback.neutral: Think about the major powers in the two alliances.
feedback.correct: That's right — these nations opposed the Axis Powers.
feedback.incorrect: Not quite. Remember which nations fought against Germany, Italy, and Japan.

answer_feedback.2: Germany was one of the Axis Powers.
